image.altText: Fred Newman is sitting at a brown wooden table with his energy bill

props.synopsis:
The South Australian government informed the ACCC after global energy giant ENGIE admitted to incorrectly telling a customer that power prices are set by the government.

Â

title.children: Energy giant admits misleading customer about power prices

image.altText: Facebook photo of Adelaide man Glenn Holton.

props.synopsis: Glenn Holton was allegedly gunned down "callously and needlessly" on a suburban Adelaide street in December 2022 by his ex-girlfriend's new partner, Michael Craig Stanley, who is now standing trial accused of his murder.

title.children: Alleged murderer 'callously' shot girlfriend's ex-partner, jury told

image.altText: A low building clad in corrugated metal stands in an outback area.

props.synopsis: A medical centre in outback SA has launched an internal review after a man suffering from a suspected heart attack was refused entry and had to be treated at the local pub instead.

title.children: Man treated in pub after being denied access to outback medical clinic

image.altText: An Adelaide Crows player grimaces after an injury as a trainer supports his back as he checks his knee.

props.synopsis: A dynamic Adelaide forward loses his race against time to be fit for the qualifying final against Collingwood.

title.children: Crows rule out dynamic forward Rachele for Magpies final

image.altText: A soy sauce container in the shape of a fish.

props.synopsis: South Australia has become the first state in Australia to ban fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers as it continues to phase out single-use plastics. The premier says the state is leading the way and he expects other states will follow.

title.children: Nation-first ban on fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers begins in SA

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Police and the SA Premier are urging a man who was seen at Adelaide's March for Australia holding an "offensive" and "outrageous" sign depicting alleged killer and wanted man Dezi Freeman to hand himself in.

title.children: Dezi Freeman placard at anti-immigration rally 'disgraceful', SA Police say

image.altText: Sonnet shouts happily, her arms in the air in love-you hand gesture, red hill, dirt, shows the ouback. She wears white shirt.

props.synopsis: Sonnet Cure is a singer in two bands and starred in the ABC's Headliners TV show. She was born deaf in one ear, so writing music is as much about "feeling it" as hearing it. Â Â

title.children: Deaf muso says community key for performers with disability

image.altText: A bearded older man wears an oxygen tube, holds a broken tile and a tile cutter next to a bonding glue in a room

props.synopsis: Under the careful tutelage of Albert "Doc" Todd, patients at a South Australian palliative care service are turning plain tables into colourful pieces of art.

title.children: Hospital art project helps 'leave a glow', palliative care patient says

image.altText: Old, rusty, red ute on the right hand side. Red dirt and clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: In the remote town of Andamooka, even native plants struggle to survive. Scientists are trying to find a solution to food security, a problem shared by outback residents and future space travellers.

title.children: Outback SA is likened to Mars. Would it be easier to grow plants there?

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Documents reveal the scale of carbon pollution leaking from a Darwin LNG tank was like adding 8,300 new cars to the road every year. It is about to be filled again.

title.children: 'Huge' leak from gas plant kept secret from public in 'national scandal'

image.altText: A man in a cap and jacket stands in front of black stud inside a barn

props.synopsis: Farmers have turned out in droves to compete at South Australia's largest agricultural event after a challenging year facing drought conditions.

title.children: Families and farmers flock to SA's largest carnival and agricultural show

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and hat in a bus filled with glassware cabinets.

props.synopsis: At 33, house painter Jeff Morgan broke his hand and suffered a strange injury that unravelled his life. It was at the kitchen table, where his children were painting with watercolours, that he found his calling.Â

title.children: House painter turned 'kaleidoscope bus' artist finds his calling

image.altText: A young boy crying next to three women sitting in outside next to a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says signatories to the genocide convention, including Australia, should prevent arms sales to Israel and uphold international law.

title.children: Leading scholars say Israel committing genocide in Gaza

image.altText: Anne Ruston in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The Coalition, Greens and independent senator David Pocock team up to pressure the government to bring forward 20,000 home support packages, after the government's promised release of 83,000 was pushed back from July to November.Â

title.children: Labor faces Senate showdown over home supports for older Australians

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Journalists in Australia are among dozens of reporters who fear for their lives and those of family members after receiving death threats from the Iranian regime.Â

title.children: Iran threats spark fear that journalists 'could die on the streets of Melbourne'

image.altText: An image showing a middle-aged man staring down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: A week on from a shooting in Victoria's north east that killed two police officers, the alleged gunman remains on the run.

title.children: Police believe Dezi Freeman is being helped and that's forced them to change tack

image.altText: People in the streets of Sydney on a wintery day all rugged up

props.synopsis: The general sentiment that Australia just shivered through a cold winter is false âalthough it wasn't as warm as forecasts predicted pre-season.

title.children: Was Australia's winter actually colder than normal?

image.altText: A large room is full of household items with a man in a helmet taking a photo with his phone of it

props.synopsis: After protests turned violent over MP perks in Indonesia, mobs looted the homes of four suspended parliamentarians, stealing some luxury items while destroying others including sports cars.Â

title.children: Looters ransack Indonesian MPs' houses, taking luxury watches, bags and even cats

image.altText: Aerial shot of large ship leaving port.

props.synopsis: Options for the new Spirit of Tasmania ship to "ease the housing crisis" in Scotland or accommodate "displaced residents" in California were passed over in favour of it being docked at a cost to Tasmanian taxpayers of around $600 a month, documents reveal.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania ferry lease options and final costs revealed

image.altText: ASX board viewed behind a person's head walking past window

props.synopsis: The ASX at record highs is 'overvalued', according to market analysts, who say investors are paying too much for shares, considering some of Australia's largest companies revealed underwhelming profits during the August reporting season.

title.children: 'Gale-force volatility' hits Aussie shares amid profit hits and misses

image.altText: Tony Burke and David Adeang sit at a desk and sign documents.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says an agreement with Nauru to settle members of the so-called NZYQ cohort in exchange for hundreds of millions of dollars was not done in secret, but declined to elaborate on the arrangement.

title.children: Prime minister insists $408m deportation deal with Nauru not a 'secret'

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands and smile in front of two national flags

props.synopsis: The pair reportedly spoke for an hour one-on-one before the formal meeting began and held hands in front of the cameras.Â

title.children: Modi meets Putin in China as tensions simmer with US over Russian oil imports

image.altText: a teenage boy looks at the camera wearing a cap and headphone. His mum stands at his side smiling at him lovingly.

props.synopsis: Special assistance schools are experiencing growing demand as traditional classrooms fall short of meeting the needs of neurodivergent students.

title.children: Neurodivergent students exit mainstream in droves amid school refusal crisis

image.altText: A group of people at a rally surrounded by Australian flags. Among them is a black megaphone with white symbols.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party distances itself from suspected far-right activists at a March for Australia rally in Townsville against immigration.

title.children: Katter says he was unaware man at rally was wearing neo-Nazi insignia

image.altText: Woman holds her young son in a city street.

props.synopsis: A working mum has hit out at the way the closure of a Tasmanian town's childcare centre has been handled, with families left without an option for their kids.

title.children: 'We all went into panic': Families' dismay over childcare announcement

image.altText: A stylised collage shows polaroid frames around photos of a young boy, and a young man at centre

props.synopsis: The ABC has obtained a voice recording of a WA police officer laughing about the suicide of an Aboriginal prisoner. It comes as new data shows the state has the highest rates of Indigenous deaths in custody in Australia.Â

title.children: Linton warned a police officer he was going to die, then when he did, she laughed

image.altText: A sign in an ALDI store saying "we support Aussie farmers", full of vegetables.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission accuses growers of forming a cartel to fix prices of vegetables supplied to Aldi in three states.

title.children: ACCC accuses four Aldi vegetable suppliers of fixing prices

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin is determined to continue the bloodshed in Ukraine and has shown no interest in genuine peace talks, a top aide to Volodymyr Zelenskyy has claimed in an exclusive interview with the ABC.

title.children: This man has spoken to the Kremlin. He says Putin 'wants to keep war going'

image.altText: A middle-aged man in glasses sits indoors, near a man holding cash in his hand.

props.synopsis: A respected Queensland council worker suffered a career-ending psychiatric injury after the fake email, which referred to a Indigenous people as "dirty bastards", was tabled in parliament by an MP on an anti-corruption crusade.

title.children: Council ordered to pay millions over fabricated racist email

image.altText: Snoop Dogg

props.synopsis: Andrew Dillon is not concerned by the negative publicity surrounding the league's decision to hire controversial American rapper Snoop Dogg for its grand final entertainment.

title.children: 'He'll do a great job': AFL boss unmoved by Snoop Dogg grand final blow back

image.altText: Photo of person smiling with mouth closed and head tilted, with dark hair across their face.

props.synopsis: At 51, Australian-born MÄori writer Anne-Marie Te Whiu found she finally had time to reflect on her life. The result is a powerful new poetry collection, Mettle; an expansive collection, which invites readers in.

title.children: 'Survival isn't enough': In new poetry collection, author asks readers to push further

image.altText: Shackled migrants deplane an aircraft as officials herd them down the stairs.

props.synopsis: Migrant children from Guatemala had already boarded planes in Texas when a federal judge in Washington DC halted their deportation.

title.children: Why has the US had to stop deportations of Guatemalan children?

image.altText: A young boy smiling

props.synopsis: The heartbroken parents of Jack Davey, a Melbourne schoolboy killed by an out-of-control car, say their lives have been destroyed by the devastating crash.

title.children: Parents of schoolboy Jack Davey say son's life was 'stolen' by driver

image.altText: An image of a phone screen with an image of a photo it snapped accompanied by a chunk of text

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is predicted to influence many sectors of work, and it is no longer a question of if, but how. Yet experts say the technology can also bring opportunities.

title.children: Here's what job sectors are most and least at risk from AI
